trans-unit.source: /mode +q $~a # quiet all users who are not authenticated /mode +r # do not allow unauthenticated users into the channel

1. The decorated function must have a service_instance parameter or a **kwarg type argument (name of argument is not important); 2. If the service_instance parameter is already defined, the value is passed through to the decorated function; 3. If the service_instance parameter in not defined, the connection is created using the proxy details and the service instance is returned.
1. Updating the database of available ports is quite resource-intensive. However,

2. In some cases MacPorts doesn't always realize when another copy of itself is running and will gleefully tromp all over the available ports database. This makes MacPorts behave in undefined ways until a fresh complete copy is retrieved.
32-bit packages can be installed on 64-bit systems by appending the architecture designation (.i686, .i586, etc.) to the end of the package name.
32-bit packages can be installed on 64-bit systems by appending the architecture designation (:i386, etc.) to the end of the package name.
32-bit packages can be upgraded on 64-bit systems by appending the architecture designation (.i686, .i586, etc.) to the end of the package name.
::parameter: all. Default: False. Remove all snapshots, if set to True.

:param keyspace The keyspace name to check for. :type keyspace: str :param contact_points: The Cassandra cluster addresses, can either be a string or a list of IPs. :type contact_points: str | list[str] :param cql_user: The Cassandra user if authentication is turned on. :type cql_user: str :param cql_pass: The Cassandra user password if authentication is turned on. :type cql_pass: str :param port: The Cassandra cluster port, defaults to None. :type port: int :return: The info for the keyspace or False if it does not exist. :rtype: dict
:param router:router name or ID to query. :param profile: Profile to build on (Optional) :return: L3 agents message.
:param timestamp_fmt The date format for the timestamp parameter.
:return a dictionary with the results of the probes.
Host grains to match the event tag
Host DNS grain to match the IP address in the event data
Hostname grains to match the event tag
archive.cmd_unzip, which uses the unzip CLI command to extract ZIP files.
archive.unzip, which uses Python's zipfile module to extract ZIP files.
Augeas can be used to manage configuration files.
docker-exec: Native support for executing commands in Docker containers (added in Docker 1.3)
nsenter: Enters container namespace to run command
systemd-nspawn(1) is a tool used to manage lightweight namespace containers. This execution module provides several functions to help manage these containers.

Vagrant is a tool for building and managing virtual machine environments. It can use various providers, such as VirtualBox, Docker, or VMware, to run its VMs. Vagrant provides some of the functionality of a light-weight hypervisor. The combination of Salt modules, Vagrant running on the host, and a virtual machine provider, gives hypervisor-like functionality for developers who use Vagrant to quickly define their virtual environments.
NotImplementedError -- For all versions of Windows that are not Windows 10
ValueError -- If the value of source is an invalid path or otherwise causes cp.cache_file to return False
Include declaration objects can be created with the include function, while Extend declaration objects can be created with the extend function, whose arguments are just Function declaration objects.
Targeting minions using pillar data - The user can configure certain information in the Pillar data and then use it to identify minions
PillarStack is a custom saltstack ext_pillar which was inspired by varstack but is heavily based on Jinja2 for maximum flexibility.
Uptime is an open source remote monitoring application using Node.js, MongoDB, and Twitter Bootstrap.
Issue #35523 was opened to track the addition of a suitable replacement or fix.

lxc-attach: Default for older versions of docker
python-jenkins Python module (not to be confused with jenkins)
pass is an encrypted on-disk password store.
Server Density Is a hosted monitoring service.
tag:key=value - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource.
"SOFTWARE\Python"'SOFTWARE\Python' (will not work on a Windows Master)
$BANKEYS_* is a Redis SET containing the list of keys under the current bank
$BANK_* is a Redis SET containing the list of banks under the current bank
$KEY_* keeps the value of the key

<host_path>:<container_path>:<read_only>,<selinux_context> - host_path is mounted within the container as container_path, with the read-only or read-write setting explicitly defined. Additionally, the specified selinux context will be set within the container.
<host_path>:<container_path>:<read_only> - host_path is mounted within the container as container_path, with the read-only or read-write setting explicitly defined.

<host_path>:<container_path>:<selinux_context> - host_path is mounted within the container as container_path with read-write access. Additionally, the specified selinux context will be set within the container.
<host_path>:<container_path> - host_path is mounted within the container as container_path with read-write access.
<read_only> can be either ro for read-write access, or ro for read-only access. When omitted, it is assumed to be read-write.
<read_only> can be either rw for read-write access, or ro for read-only access. When omitted, it is assumed to be read-write.
<selinux_context> can be z if the volume is shared between multiple containers, or Z if the volume should be private.
'add' to add one or more values to the attribute

'delete' to delete some or all of the values from the attribute. If no values are specified with this operation, all of the attribute's values are deleted. Otherwise, only the named values are deleted.
'password' is, of course, the password for which you want to generate a hash.
'replace' to replace all of the attribute's values with zero or more new values
--no-dev option for composer. Recommended for production.
--optimize-autoloader option of composer. Recommended for production.
--quiet option for composer. Whether or not to return output from composer.
-s enables the generation of a stateconf
Added - A list of paths that were added.
Already_Pulled - Layers that that were already present on the Minion
Already_Pushed - Layers that that were already present on the Minion
Changed - A list of paths that were changed.

Chassis.cmd acts as a "shim" between the execution module and the proxy. It's first parameter is always the function from salt.modules.dracr to execute. If the function takes more positional or keyword arguments you can append them to the call. It's this shim that speaks to the chassis through the proxy, arranging for the credentials and hostname to be pulled from the pillar section for this proxy minion.
Command - The command executed in this build step
CommandExecutionError -- If reg.exe exits with a non-0 exit code
CommandExecutionError -- If SNMP settings are being managed by Group Policy
Comment - Any error encountered when trying to prune a dangling image
Containers - A list of containers which depend on the specified image
Deleted - A list of paths that were deleted.
Errors - A list of any errors that were encountered
Errors - A list of errors encountered during the course of this function.
False if at least one change was unable to be applied.
False will be in minutes. Default is False.
False: the ticket exists and it has not been closed.
HOME variable is sometimes not set for processes running as system services. If you want to rely on the default credential store location, make sure HOME is set for the proxy process.
Image - Name of tag applied to topmost layer
Images - A dictionary containing one or more of the following keys:
Images - A list of IDs of images which depend on the specified image
Intermediate_Containers - IDs of containers created during the course of the build process
Job information is also tracked and delivered.
L: Make \w, \W, \b, \B, \s and \S dependent on the locale.
Layers - A dictionary containing one or more of the following keys:
Layers - A list containing the IDs of the layers which were loaded. Any layers in the file that was loaded, which were already present on the Minion, will not be included.
Layers - A list of the IDs of image layers that were removed
M: Treat multiple lines as a single line.
Minion information is a dictionary keyed by each connected minion's id (mid), grains information for each minion is also included.
NOTE: For apt, ebuild, pacman, winrepo, yumpkg, and zypper, version numbers can be specified in the pkgs argument. For example:
NOTE: When using comparison operators, the expression must be enclosed in quotes to avoid a YAML render error.
None if changes would be applied but it is in test mode.
None: instance(s) not valid or not registered, no action taken
Null: put each minion return on a single line.
Official - A boolean (True if an official build, False if not)
Path - Path of the file that was exported
Path - Path of the file that was saved
Push - Reports whether or not the file was successfully pushed to the Master
Removed - A boolean (True if prune was successful, False if not)
Results - A dictionary mapping registry URLs to the authentication result. True means a successful login, False means a failed login.
Size - Size of the file, in bytes
Size_Human - Cumulative image size, in human-readable units
Size_Human - Size of the file, in human-readable units
Stars - Number of stars the image has on the registry
Status - A string containing a summary of the pull action (usually a message saying that an image was downloaded, or that it was up to date).
Tags - A list of the tags that were removed
Time_Created_Epoch - Time this build step was completed (Epoch time)
Time_Created_Local - Time this build step was completed (Minion's local timezone)
Time_Elapsed - Time in seconds taken to load the file
Time_Elapsed - Time in seconds taken to perform the build
Time_Elapsed - Time in seconds taken to perform the commit
Time_Elapsed - Time in seconds taken to perform the export
Time_Elapsed - Time in seconds taken to perform the pull
Time_Elapsed - Time in seconds taken to perform the push
Time_Elapsed - Time in seconds taken to perform the save
True if no changes were necessary or if all changes were applied successfully.
True if successful (a reboot will occur), otherwise False
True if successful (a shutdown or reboot will occur), otherwise False
True if successful or if the service is already disabled
True if successful or if the service is already enabled
True if successful or if the service is already running
True if successful or if the service is already stopped
True if successful, raise CommandExecutionError if not, or the stdout of the launchctl command if requested
True if successful, raises an exception otherwise.
True if the Requires reboot registry flag is set to 1, otherwise False
True if the a reboot request was witnessed, False otherwise
True if the destroy was successful, otherwise False.
True if the service is available, False otherwise
True if the service is missing, False otherwise
True if the system is pending reboot, otherwise False
True if there are pending Component Based Servicing tasks, otherwise False
True if there are pending Server Manager tasks, otherwise False
True if there are pending file rename operations, otherwise False
True if there are pending updates, otherwise False
True if there is a pending domain join action, otherwise False
True to create a QCOW2 disk image with image as backing file. If False the file pointed to by the image property will simply be copied. (Default: False)
True to create a QCOW2 overlay image, rather than copying the image (Default: False).
True to inherit permissions from the parent key. False to disable inheritance. Default is True.
True to seed the disk image. Only used when the image parameter is provided.
True to setup a vnc display for the VM (Default: False)
True will cause the timeout parameter to be in seconds.
True will restart the computer after a successful join. Default is False
True will restart the computer after successful unjoin. Default is False

True will sleep for timeout + 30 seconds after reboot has been initiated. This is useful for use in a highstate. For example, you may have states that you want to apply only after the reboot. Default is False.
True: the ticket exists and it is closed.
Trusted - A boolean (True if a trusted build, False if not)
Warning - Message describing any problems encountered in attemp to tag the topmost layer
^filename is the only required parameter. Any parameter that begins with a ^ is passed directly to the underlying file authentication function via kwargs, with the leading ^ being stripped.

__env__ - The effective salt fileserver environment (i.e. base). Also referred to as a "saltenv". __env__ should not be modified in a pure python SLS file. To use a different environment, the environment should be set when executing the state. This can be done in a couple different ways:
__grains__: a dictionary of the grains of the minion making this pillar call
__opts__: a dictionary of mostly Salt configuration options
__salt__: a dictionary of Salt module functions, useful so you don't have to duplicate functions that already exist (note: runs on the master)
__sls__ - The SLS path of the file. For example, if the root of the base environment is /srv/salt, and the SLS file is /srv/salt/foo/bar/baz.sls, then __sls__ in that file will be foo.bar.baz.
allocated_outbound_ports: The number of outbound ports to be used for NAT.
alt_host_keys - If True, host keys will be loaded from the file specified in alt_key_file (default: False)
alt_key_file - SSH host key file to use (if alt_host_keys=True)

always_alive - In certain less dynamic environments, maintaining the remote connection permanently open with the network device is not always beneficial. In that case, the user can select to initialize the connection only when needed, by setting this option to False. By default this option is set to True (maintains the connection with the remote network device)
applicationPool - The application pool for the webapp
args: list of arguments to be sent to the Netmiko method.
args: list of arguments to send to the name method.
as_number: the AS number of the neighbor

authorityKeyIdentifier Use values acceptable to the openssl CLI tools. This will automatically populate authorityKeyIdentifier with the subjectKeyIdentifier of signing_cert. If this is a self-signed cert these values will be the same.
backend_address_pool: Name of the backend address pool object used by the load balancing rule object. Inbound traffic is randomly load balanced across IPs in the backend IPs.
backend_address_pool: Name of the backend address pool object used by the outbound NAT rule object. Outbound traffic is randomly load balanced across IPs in the backend IPs.
backend_port: The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65535. Note that value 0 enables 'Any Port'.
backend_port: The port used for internal connections to the endpoint. Acceptable values are between 1 and 65535.
backend_port: The port used for the internal endpoint. Acceptable values range from 1 to 65535.
bridge - Creates a new network stack for the container on the docker bridge
child: the child line (as text). If no child line matched, this field will be None.

ciphersalt is a combination of a cipher identifier, an optional number of rounds, and the cryptographic salt. The arrangement and format of these fields depends on the cipher and which flavor of BSD you are using. For more information on this, see the manpage for crpyt(3). On NetBSD, additional information is available in passwd.conf(5).
cloned_from is only use if the filesystem does not exist yet, when cloned_from is set after the filesystem exists it will be ignored.
cloned_from is only use if the volume does not exist yet, when cloned_from is set after the volume exists it will be ignored.
cmd.wait itself does not do anything; all functionality is inside its mod_watch function, which is called by watch on changes.
comment - Only present if the container can not be stopped
comment - Only present if the container can not be unpaused
comment - Only present if the container cannot be killed
comment - Only present if the container cannot be paused
comment - Only present if the container cannot be started
comment - Only present if the container is already stopped
connect_container_to_network - arguments used by connect_container_to_network() to construct an endpoint config when connecting to a network (used by docker.connect_container_to_network)
connection_stats: returning an output of the form <State> <Active>/<Received>/<Accepted>/<Damped>, e.g. Established 398/399/399/0 similar to the usual output from network devices.
container:<container_name_or_id> reuses another container shared memory, semaphores and message queues
containerPort - Bind an ephemeral port on all of the host's interfaces to a specific port within the container.

control - If set to True, then any message which starts with the trigger string (which defaults to ! and can be overridden by setting the trigger option in the engine configuration) will be interpreted as a Salt CLI command and the engine will attempt to run it. The permissions defined in the various groups will determine if the Slack user is allowed to run the command. The targets and default_target options can be used to set targets for a given command, but the engine can also read the following two keyword arguments:

copy_grains - If True, Salt will copy the grains passed into the beacon when it backs them up to check for changes on the next iteration. Normally, instead of copy, it would use straight value assignment. This will allow detection of changes to grains where the grains are modified in-place instead of completely replaced. In-place grains changes are not currently done in the main Salt code but may be done due to a custom plug-in. Defaults to False.
creates also accepts a list of files:
dayweek (0 to 6 are Sunday through Saturday, 7 can also be used for Sunday)
default_enter - Character(s) to send to correspond to enter key (default: \n)
device_type - Class selection based on device type. Supported options:
disable_outbound_snat: Configures SNAT for the VMs in the backend pool to use the public IP address specified in the frontend of the load balancing rule.

dns_servers: List of DNS server IP addresses. Use 'AzureProvidedDNS' to switch to Azure provided DNS resolution. 'AzureProvidedDNS' value cannot be combined with other IPs, it must be the only value in dns_servers collection.

docker.exec_driver: Execution driver to use, one of nsenter, lxc-attach, or docker-exec. See the Executing Commands Within a Running Container section for more details on how this config parameter is used.
docker.url: URL to the docker service (default: local socket).
docker.version: API version to use (should not need to be set manually in the vast majority of cases)
ebuild.ex_mod_init is called automatically when a state invokes a pkg state on a Gentoo system. salt.states.pkg.mod_init()

enable_floating_ip: Configures a virtual machine's endpoint for the floating IP capability required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group. This setting is required when using the SQL AlwaysOn Availability Groups in SQL server. This setting can't be changed after you create the endpoint.

entries is an iterable of dicts. Each of these dict's keys are the distinguished names (DNs) of LDAP entries to manage. Each of these dicts is processed in order. A later dict can reference an LDAP entry that was already mentioned in an earlier dict, which makes it possible for later dicts to enhance or alter the desired state of an LDAP entry.

esxi.cmd acts as a "shim" between the execution module and the proxy. Its first parameter is always the function from salt.modules.vsphere. If the function takes more positional or keyword arguments you can append them to the call. It's this shim that speaks to the ESXi host through the proxy, arranging for the credentials and hostname to be pulled from the Pillar section for this Proxy Minion.
export_policy: the name of the export policy
fields Which fields from the returned data to include in the subject line
file-types: a string of one or more of the following:

file.replace reads the entire file as a string to support multiline regex patterns. Therefore, when using anchors such as ^ or $ in the pattern, those anchors may be relative to the line OR relative to the file. The default for file.replace is to treat anchors as relative to the line, which is implemented by setting the default value of flags to ['MULTILINE']. When overriding the default value for flags, if 'MULTILINE' is not present then anchors will be relative to the file. If the desired behavior is for anchors to be relative to the line, then simply add 'MULTILINE' to the list of flags.
file: save the output into a temporary file and upload
file_client: local must be set in the minion config file.
fire_all - If set to True, all messages which are not prefixed with the trigger string will fired as events onto Salt's ref:
from (required) The name/address of the email sender.
frontend_ip_configuration: Name of the frontend IP configuration object used by the inbound NAT pool object.
frontend_ip_configuration: Name of the frontend IP configuration object used by the inbound NAT rule object.
frontend_ip_configuration: Name of the frontend IP configuration object used by the load balancing rule object.
frontend_ip_configuration: Name of the frontend IP configuration object used by the outbound NAT rule object.
frontend_port: The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65534. Note that value 0 enables 'Any Port'.
frontend_port: The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Acceptable values range from 1 to 65534.

frontend_port_range_end: The last port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound NAT to NICs associated with a load balancer. Acceptable values range between 1 and 65535.

frontend_port_range_start: The first port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound NAT to NICs associated with a load balancer. Acceptable values range between 1 and 65534.

full_id, terse_id, mixed_id, changes_id and filter_id If _id is used, then the corresponding form will be used, but the value for name will be drawn from the state ID. This is useful for cases where the name value might be very long and hard to read.
g: Replace all occurrences of the pattern, not just the first.
get_sum cannot really be trusted since it is vulnerable to collisions: get_sum(..., 'xyz') == 'Hash xyz not supported'

git archive permits a partial archive to be created. Thus, this path does not need to be the root of the git repository. Only the files within the directory specified by cwd (and its subdirectories) will be in the resulting archive. For example, if there is a git checkout at /tmp/foo, then passing /tmp/foo/bar as the cwd will result in just the files underneath /tmp/foo/bar to be exported as an archive.
git also works here. Prior to the 2018.3.0 release, onlygit would work.
gpgowner A user's ~/.gpg directory. This must contain a gpg
grains.<grain_name>[i] where i is an integer representing the index of the grain to use. If the grain is not a list, the index is ignored.
group is a virtual module that is fulfilled by one of the following modules:
groups: a space and/or comma separated list of group names and/or gids
hg also works here. Prior to the 2018.3.0 release, onlyhg would work.
host (required) The SMTP server hostname or address.
host - Hostname of target device (not required if ip is provided)
host - Use the host's network stack inside the container
host: use the host's shared memory, semaphores and message queues
hostPort:containerPort - Bind a specific port on all of the host's interfaces to a specific port within the container.
host_config - arguments accepted by create_host_config() (used to build the host config for docker.create)
hostname cannot be set if network_mode is set to host. The below example will result in an error:
http_dc_validation must be set to False if this option is used.

idle_timeout_in_minutes: The timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.
import_* and load_* tags will automatically expose their target variable to import. This feature makes catalog of data to handle.
import_policy: the name of the import policy
installed is always returned, if None or False also returns error and may also return stdout for diagnostics.

interface_description: matches the neighbor details with the corresponding interface and returns its description. This will reuse functionality from the net runner, so the user needs to enable the mines as specified in the documentation.

interface_name: matches the neighbor details with the corresponding interface and returns the name. Similar to interface_description, this will reuse functionality from the net runner, so the user needs to enable the mines as specified in the documentation.
internal_dns_name_label: Relative DNS name for this NIC used for internal communications between VMs in the same virtual network.

internal_domain_name_suffix: Even if internal_dns_name_label is not specified, a DNS entry is created for the primary NIC of the VM. This DNS name can be constructed by concatenating the VM name with the value of internal_domain_name_suffix.
internal_fqdn: Fully qualified DNS name supporting internal communications between VMs in the same virtual network.

interval_in_seconds: The interval, in seconds, for how frequently to probe the endpoint for health status. Typically, the interval is slightly less than half the allocated timeout period (in seconds) which allows two full probes before taking the instance out of rotation. The default value is 15, the minimum value is 5.
ip::containerPort - Bind a specific IP and an ephemeral port to a specific port within the container.
ip:hostPort:containerPort - Bind a specific IP and port on the host to a specific port within the container.
ip - IP address of target device (not required if host is provided)
ipam_config - arguments used to create an IPAM pool (used by docker.create_network in the process of constructing an IPAM config dictionary)
iptables.save_filters: List of REGEX strings to FILTER OUT matching lines
item2 is ignored if this option is is set to True.
keep_newline should be turned on if the pillar data is intended to be used to deploy a file using contents_pillar with a file.managed state.

keepalive - Send SSH keepalive packets at a specific interval, in seconds. Currently defaults to 0, for backwards compatibility (it will not attempt to keep the connection alive using the KEEPALIVE packets).
kernelpkg is a virtual module that is fulfilled by one of the following modules:
key_file - Filename path of the SSH key file to use
kwargs: dictionary of arguments to be sent to the Netmiko method.
kwargs: key-value arguments to send to the name method.
label - only remove objects matching the label expression. Valid expressions include labelname or labelname=value.
load_distribution: The load distribution policy for this rule. Possible values are 'Default', 'SourceIP', and 'SourceIPProtocol'.
machinectl poweroff is only supported in systemd >= 219. On earlier systemd versions, running this function will simply issue a clean shutdown via systemctl.
machinectl reboot is only supported in systemd >= 219. On earlier systemd versions, running this function will instead restart the container via systemctl.
machinectl terminate is only supported in systemd >= 219. On earlier systemd versions, running this function will simply issue a clean shutdown via systemctl.
match: a boolean value that tells whether child_regex matched any children lines.
merge_files may also be specified, which includes a string or list of strings representing a file or files to be appended to the end of the CA bundle, once it is downloaded.
message_details: details extracted from the syslog message
minion also works here. Prior to the 2018.3.0 release, onlyminion would work.
model_name: the OpenConfig or IETF model name
mongo.db - The mongo database to connect to. Defaults to 'salt'.
mongo.host - The mongo host to connect to. Supports replica sets by specifying all hosts in the set, comma-delimited. Defaults to 'salt'.
mongo.password - The password for connecting to mongo. Only required if you are using mongo authentication. Defaults to ''.
mongo.port - The port that the mongo database is running on. Defaults to 27017.
mongo.user - The username for connecting to mongo. Only required if you are using mongo authentication. Defaults to ''.
multiprocessing - Overrides the multiprocessing option, per proxy minion, as the Netmiko communication channel is mainly SSH (default: False)
name and pattern were kept for backwards compatibility reasons.
name is an alias for the entryname argument, pattern is an alias for log_file. These aliases will only be used if the entryname and log_file arguments are not passed.
name: The name of the resource that is unique within a resource group.
name: the name of the Netmiko function to invoke.
name: the name of the Netmiko method to be executed.
none - No networking (equivalent of the Docker CLI argument --net=none). Not to be confused with Python's None.
notconfigured can only be used when using the lgpo store
nspawn.list also works to list running containers

number_of_probes: The number of probes where if no response, will result in stopping further traffic from being delivered to the endpoint. This values allows endpoints to be taken out of rotation faster or slower than the typical times used in Azure.
op identifies the modification operation to perform. One of:
password - Password to authenticate against target device, if required
password The password used to authenticate to the server.
password: contents of user certificate (pem-encoded user public key);
path-regex: a Python Regex (regular expression) pattern to match pathnames
physicalPath - The physical path of the webapp
pillar: the pillar data (as passed by Salt to our ext_pillar function)
pkg is a virtual module that is fulfilled by one of the following modules:
pkg_add(1) does not use a local database of available packages, so this function simply returns True. it exists merely for API compatibility.
pkg_add(1) is not capable of querying for remote packages, so this function will always return results as if there is no package available for install or upgrade.
port - The destination port used to connect to the target device
port - The port of the service to announce
port The SMTP server port; defaults to 25.
port: The port for communicating the probe. Possible values range from 1 to 65535, inclusive.
pretty: use four-space indents and sort the keys.
private_ip_address: The private IP address of the IP configuration. Required if 'private_ip_allocation_method' is 'Static'.
private_ip_allocation_method: The Private IP allocation method. Possible values are: 'Static' and 'Dynamic'.
probe: Name of the probe object used by the load balancing rule object.
probe_count - Total number of probes per test (1..15). System defaults: 1 on both JunOS & Cisco.
probe_interval - Delay between tests (0..86400 seconds). System defaults: 3 on JunOS, 5 on Cisco.

protocol: The protocol of the endpoint. Possible values are 'Http' or 'Tcp'. If 'Tcp' is specified, a received ACK is required for the probe to be successful. If 'Http' is specified, a 200 OK response from the specified URI is required for the probe to be successful.
public_ip_address: Name of an existing public IP address which will be assigned to the frontend IP object.
redis.db - The Redis database to use. Defaults to 0.
redis.host - The Redis host to connect to. Defaults to 'salt'.
redis.password - The password for authenticating with Redis. Only required if you are using master auth. Defaults to None.
redis.port - The port that the Redis database is listening on. Defaults to 6379.
remove_config may fail to reset the DSC environment if any of the files in the ConfigurationStatus directory. If you wait a few minutes and run again, it may complete successfully.
renderer A Salt renderer, or render-pipe, to use to render the email
request_path: The URI used for requesting health status from the VM. Path is required if a protocol is set to 'Http'. Otherwise, it is not allowed. There is no default value.

reset_on_change - If True and there is a change in TXT records detected, it will stop announcing the service and then restart announcing the service. This interruption in service announcement may be desirable if the client relies on changes in the browse records to update its cache of TXT records. Defaults to False.

reset_wait - The number of seconds to wait after announcement stops announcing and before it restarts announcing in the case where there is a change in TXT records detected and reset_on_change is True. Defaults to 0.
response_return - Character(s) to use in normalized return data to represent enter key (default: \n)
restarted - If restart was successful, this key will be present and will be set to True.
result - A boolean noting whether or not the action was successful

router.config depends on the location of the SLS file (see above). Running this command, will be executed all five steps from above. These examples above are not meant to be used in a production environment, their sole purpose is to provide usage examples.
rpm Python module. Install with zypper install rpm-python
salt:// to fetch from the Salt fileserver.
salt://, to fetch the file from the Salt fileserver.
salt://, to fetch the template from the Salt fileserver.
secret - The enable password if target device requires one
service is a virtual module that is fulfilled by one of the following modules:
servicename - Set the name of the service. Will use the hostname from the minion's host grain if this value is not set.
session_timeout - Set a timeout for parallel requests, in seconds (default: 60)
shadow is a virtual module that is fulfilled by one of the following modules:
source - Specifies the source IP Address to be used during the tests. If not specified will use the IP Address of the logical interface loopback0.
sqlcipher.database - The SQLCipher database to connect to. Defaults to '/var/lib/salt/pillar-sqlcipher.db'.
sqlite3 is included in the stdlib since Python 2.5.
ssh_config_file - File name of OpenSSH configuration file
ssh_strict - Automatically reject unknown SSH host keys (default: False, which means unknown SSH host keys will be accepted)
stack: the MakoStack pillar data object that has currently been merged (data from previous yaml files in MakoStack configuration)
stack: the PillarStack pillar data object that has currently been merged (data from previous yaml files in PillarStack configuration)
state(id) returns an object under which you can create a State declaration object by accessing an attribute named after any state module available in Salt.
status - A dictionary showing the prior state of the container as well as the new state

subjectKeyIdentifier can be an explicit value or it can be the special string hash. hash will set the subjectKeyIdentifier equal to the SHA1 hash of the modulus of the public key in this certificate. Note that this is not the exact same hashing method used by OpenSSL when using the hash value.
subnet: Name of an existing subnet inside of which the frontend IP will reside.
svn also works here. Prior to the 2018.3.0 release, onlysvn would work.
syslog_config can be passed as a quoted, comma-separated string, e.g.
system_host_keys - Load host keys from the user's "known_hosts" file (default: False)
target - The target expression to use for the command
template The path to a file to be used as a template for the email body.
template must be set to True for templating to happen.
template_instantiate creates a VM on OpenNebula from a template, but it does not install Salt on the new VM. Use the create function for that functionality: salt-cloud -p opennebula-profile vm-name.
tgt_type - The match type, can be one of glob, list, pcre, grain, grain_pcre, pillar, nodegroup, range, ipcidr, or compound. The default value is glob.
tls Whether to secure the connection using TLS; defaults to False
to (required) The names/addresses of the email recipients;
traffic_ctl is used to execute individual Traffic Server commands and to script multiple commands in a shell.
txt - The TXT record of the service being announced as a dict. Grains can be used to define TXT values using one of following two formats:
type: is role (or group if the JIRA server has configured comment visibility for groups).
until=<timestamp> - only remove objects created before given timestamp. Not applicable to volumes. See the documentation links above for examples of valid time expressions.
use_keys - Connect to target device using SSH keys (default: False)
user is a virtual module that is fulfilled by one of the following modules:
username - Username to authenticate against target device, if required
username The username used to authenticate to the server. If specified a
username: we need it to run the auth function from CLI/API;
users: a space and/or comma separated list of user names and/or uids
vals is an iterable of values to add or delete
value: the name of the role (or group) to which viewing of this comment will be restricted.
vdata is the data that will be assigned to 'version'
version is for use in determine if a shell/script language has a particular feature set, not for package management.
vname is the value name ('version') that will be created under the key
volume_size is considered a property, so the volume's size will be corrected when the properties get updated if it differs from the original volume.
volumes=True must still be used to prune volumes
vrf: return the name of the VRF.
watch can be used with service.running to restart a service when
xz or lzma for XZ compression (requires xz-utils, as well as the lzma module from Python 3.3, available in Python 2 and Python 3.0-3.2 as backports.lzma)
yum-utils will already be installed on the minion if the package was installed from the Fedora / EPEL repositories.
(Only present if tag was specified and tagging failed)
(Only present if tag was specified and tagging was successful)
